jd: From: Vikas Kumar, Adventa Tech vikas@adventatech.com Reply to: vikas@adventatech.com Position: .Net developerLocation: Richmond, VA (Hybrid) (Local Only)Duration: 6 MonthsRate: $50/hr. on C2CMOI: Face2FaceOur client is looking for a .NET Developer for a HYBRID position based out of Richmond, VA. Responsibilities:The Office of the Executive Secretary of the Supreme Court of Virginia is seeking applicants for an experienced .Net Developer. The candidate will enhance, develop, and support applications for mission-critical enterprise imaging applications. The Case Imaging System (CIS), General District Imaging System (GDIS), and JDR Imaging System (JDIS) are existing production applications that require continuing enhancements, modifications, support, and development.• Software Development in VB.Net and C# environment based on user requirements.• Software maintenance for enhancements and bug fixes of existing applications.• Unit and Functional Testing.• PC support/maintenance in VB and shell scripting.• Critical Analysis and collaboration with business analysts.• Creation of deployment scripts in Linux or Windows as needed.• Experience with Version Control: GIT (Primary), or Subversion.• Training, documentation, and knowledge transfer of completed application. Qualifications:• Minimum 5+ years of proficiency with Object-Oriented development methodologies using MS .NET VB (primarily) and C# in a work environment.• Database Experience using SQL in a mission-critical relational database application.• Ability to work independently with minimal supervision.• Excellent communication skills and ability to interact with other developers and second level support engineers. Preferred Qualifications:• Informix experience storing images in blobspaces.• Operating System Experience: Unix/Linux (RHEL), Windows.• Experience with additional programming languages: Java, JavaScript Front-End Frameworks (Angular/React).• Candidates who have experience with Imaging toolkits such as GDPicture, DevExpress, and iText will receive priority consideration.• Experience with Agile programming methodology having multiple software iterations. Writing and debugging DDL/DML.• Experience with Web Server (Apache/IIS) configuration and support, SOAP/REST Webservice Development, and Consumption.• Strong troubleshooting experience using tools like Fiddler, PostMan, and SoapUI.• College degree preferred.
